intro: Dendrorkis caracasana, commonly known as the Caracasana tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The tree is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential ecological and medicinal uses.
